trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Create a pipeline with Copy Activity using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Create a pipeline with Copy Activity using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create an Azure Data Factory pipeline with a Copy Activity by using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create an Azure Data Factory pipeline with a Copy Activity by using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Create and monitor a data factory using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Create and monitor a data factory using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Tutorial Overview
trans-unit.target: Tutorial Overview

trans-unit.source: Using Data Factory Editor
trans-unit.target: Using Data Factory Editor

trans-unit.source: Using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: In This Tutorial
trans-unit.target: In This Tutorial

trans-unit.source: In This tutorial you will first create an Azure data factory named **ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS** using the Azure Preview Portal and then do the following using Visual Studio 2013:
trans-unit.target: In This tutorial you will first create an Azure data factory named **ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS** using the Azure Preview Portal and then do the following using Visual Studio 2013:

trans-unit.source: Create two linked services: **AzureStorageLinkedService1** and **AzureSqlinkedService1**.
trans-unit.target: Create two linked services: **AzureStorageLinkedService1** and **AzureSqlinkedService1**.

trans-unit.source: The AzureStorageLinkedService1 links an Azure storage and AzureSqlLinkedService1 links an Azure SQL database to the data factory: **ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS**.
trans-unit.target: The AzureStorageLinkedService1 links an Azure storage and AzureSqlLinkedService1 links an Azure SQL database to the data factory: **ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS**.

trans-unit.source: The input data for the pipeline resides in a blob container in the Azure blob storage and output data will be stored in a table in the Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: The input data for the pipeline resides in a blob container in the Azure blob storage and output data will be stored in a table in the Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you add these two data stores as linked services to the data factory.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you add these two data stores as linked services to the data factory.

trans-unit.source: Create two data factory tables: **EmpTableFromBlob** and **EmpSQLTable**, which represent the input/output data that is stored in the data stores.
trans-unit.target: Create two data factory tables: **EmpTableFromBlob** and **EmpSQLTable**, which represent the input/output data that is stored in the data stores.

trans-unit.source: For the EmpTableFromBlob, you will specify the blob container that contains a blob with the source data and for the EmpSQLTable, you will specify the SQL table that will store the output data.
trans-unit.target: For the EmpTableFromBlob, you will specify the blob container that contains a blob with the source data and for the EmpSQLTable, you will specify the SQL table that will store the output data.

trans-unit.source: You will also specify other properties such as structure of the data, availability of the data, etc...
trans-unit.target: You will also specify other properties such as structure of the data, availability of the data, etc...

trans-unit.source: Create a pipeline named **ADFTutorialPipeline** in the ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS.
trans-unit.target: Create a pipeline named **ADFTutorialPipeline** in the ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline will have a **Copy Activity** that copies input data from the Azure blob to the output Azure SQL table
trans-unit.target: The pipeline will have a **Copy Activity** that copies input data from the Azure blob to the output Azure SQL table

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: In this step, you use the Azure Preview Portal to create an Azure data factory named **ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS**.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you use the Azure Preview Portal to create an Azure data factory named **ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS**.

trans-unit.source: After logging into the [Azure Preview Portal](http://portal.azure.com), click **NEW** from the bottom-left corner, select **Data analytics** in the **Create** blade, and click **Data Factory** in the **Data analytics** blade.
trans-unit.target: After logging into the [Azure Preview Portal](http://portal.azure.com), click **NEW** from the bottom-left corner, select **Data analytics** in the **Create** blade, and click **Data Factory** in the **Data analytics** blade.

trans-unit.source: New->DataFactory
trans-unit.target: New->DataFactory

trans-unit.source: In the **New data factory** blade:
trans-unit.target: In the **New data factory** blade:

trans-unit.source: Enter **ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS** for the **name**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS** for the **name**.

trans-unit.source: New data factory blade
trans-unit.target: New data factory blade

trans-unit.source: Click **RESOURCE GROUP NAME** and do the following:
trans-unit.target: Click **RESOURCE GROUP NAME** and do the following:

trans-unit.source: Click **Create a new resource group**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create a new resource group**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Create resource group** blade, enter **ADFTutorialResourceGroup** for the **name** of the resource group, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Create resource group** blade, enter **ADFTutorialResourceGroup** for the **name** of the resource group, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Create Resource Group
trans-unit.target: Create Resource Group

trans-unit.source: Some of the steps in this tutorial assume that you use the name: **ADFTutorialResourceGroup** for the resource group.
trans-unit.target: Some of the steps in this tutorial assume that you use the name: **ADFTutorialResourceGroup** for the resource group.

trans-unit.source: To learn about resource groups, see [Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources](resource-group-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn about resource groups, see [Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources](resource-group-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: In the **New data factory** blade, notice that **Add to Startboard** is selected.
trans-unit.target: In the **New data factory** blade, notice that **Add to Startboard** is selected.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create** in the **New data factory** blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create** in the **New data factory** blade.

trans-unit.source: The name of the Azure data factory must be globally unique.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Azure data factory must be globally unique.

trans-unit.source: If you receive the error: **Data factory name “ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS” is not available**, change the name of the data factory (for example, yournameADFTutorialDataFactoryVS) and try creating again.
trans-unit.target: If you receive the error: **Data factory name “ADFTutorialDataFactoryVS” is not available**, change the name of the data factory (for example, yournameADFTutorialDataFactoryVS) and try creating again.

trans-unit.source: Use this name in place of ADFTutorialFactory while performing remaining steps in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Use this name in place of ADFTutorialFactory while performing remaining steps in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: See [Data Factory - Naming Rules][data-factory-naming-rules] topic for naming rules for Data Factory artifacts.
trans-unit.target: See [Data Factory - Naming Rules][data-factory-naming-rules] topic for naming rules for Data Factory artifacts.

trans-unit.source: Data Factory name not available
trans-unit.target: Data Factory name not available

trans-unit.source: Click **NOTIFICATIONS** hub on the left and look for notifications from the creation process.
trans-unit.target: Click **NOTIFICATIONS** hub on the left and look for notifications from the creation process.

trans-unit.source: Click **X** to close the **NOTIFICATIONS** blade if it is open.
trans-unit.target: Click **X** to close the **NOTIFICATIONS** blade if it is open.

trans-unit.source: After the creation is complete, you will see the **DATA FACTORY** blade as shown below.
trans-unit.target: After the creation is complete, you will see the **DATA FACTORY** blade as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Data factory home page
trans-unit.target: Data factory home page

trans-unit.source: Create and deploy Data Factory entities using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Create and deploy Data Factory entities using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Pre-requisites
trans-unit.target: Pre-requisites

trans-unit.source: You must have the following installed on your computer:
trans-unit.target: You must have the following installed on your computer:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.source: Download Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: Download Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to [Azure Download Page](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/) and click **VS 2013 install** in the **.NET** section.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to [Azure Download Page](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/) and click **VS 2013 install** in the **.NET** section.

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough

trans-unit.source: Create the Visual Studio project
trans-unit.target: Create the Visual Studio project

trans-unit.source: Launch **Visual Studio 2013**.
trans-unit.target: Launch **Visual Studio 2013**.

trans-unit.source: Click **File**, point to **New**, and click **Project**.
trans-unit.target: Click **File**, point to **New**, and click **Project**.

trans-unit.source: You should see the **New Project** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: You should see the **New Project** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** dialog, select the **DataFactory** template, and click **Empty Data Factory Project**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** dialog, select the **DataFactory** template, and click **Empty Data Factory Project**.

trans-unit.source: If you don't see the DataFactory template, close Visual Studio, install Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013, and reopen Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see the DataFactory template, close Visual Studio, install Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013, and reopen Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: New project dialog box
trans-unit.target: New project dialog box

trans-unit.source: Enter a **name** for the project, **location**, and a name for the **solution**, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Enter a **name** for the project, **location**, and a name for the **solution**, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Solution Explorer
trans-unit.target: Solution Explorer

trans-unit.source: Create linked services
trans-unit.target: Create linked services

trans-unit.source: Linked services link data stores or compute services to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: Linked services link data stores or compute services to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: A data store can be an Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database or an on-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: A data store can be an Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database or an on-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create two linked services: **AzureStorageLinkedService1** and **AzureSqlLinkedService1**.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create two linked services: **AzureStorageLinkedService1** and **AzureSqlLinkedService1**.

trans-unit.source: AzureStorageLinkedService1 linked service links an Azure Storage Account and AzureSqlLinkedService links an Azure SQL database to the data factory: **ADFTutorialDataFactory**.
trans-unit.target: AzureStorageLinkedService1 linked service links an Azure Storage Account and AzureSqlLinkedService links an Azure SQL database to the data factory: **ADFTutorialDataFactory**.

trans-unit.source: Create the Azure Storage linked service
trans-unit.target: Create the Azure Storage linked service

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Linked Services** in the solution explorer, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Linked Services** in the solution explorer, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add New Item** dialog box, select **Azure Storage Linked Service** from the list, and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add New Item** dialog box, select **Azure Storage Linked Service** from the list, and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: New Linked Service
trans-unit.target: New Linked Service

trans-unit.source: Replace **accountname** and **accountkey** with the name of your Azure storage account and its key.
trans-unit.target: Replace **accountname** and **accountkey** with the name of your Azure storage account and its key.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Linked Service
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Linked Service

trans-unit.source: Save the **AzureStorageLinkedService1.json** file.
trans-unit.target: Save the **AzureStorageLinkedService1.json** file.

trans-unit.source: Create the Azure SQL linked service
trans-unit.target: Create the Azure SQL linked service

trans-unit.source: Right-click on **Linked Services** node in the **Solution Explorer** again, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on **Linked Services** node in the **Solution Explorer** again, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.

trans-unit.source: This time, select **Azure SQL Linked Service**, and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: This time, select **Azure SQL Linked Service**, and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In the **AzureSqlLinkedService1.json file**, replace **servername**, **databasename**, **username@servername**, and **password** with names of your Azure SQL server, database, user account, and password.
trans-unit.target: In the **AzureSqlLinkedService1.json file**, replace **servername**, **databasename**, **username@servername**, and **password** with names of your Azure SQL server, database, user account, and password.

trans-unit.source: Save the **AzureSqlLinkedService1.json** file.
trans-unit.target: Save the **AzureSqlLinkedService1.json** file.

trans-unit.source: Create input and output tables
trans-unit.target: Create input and output tables

trans-unit.source: In the previous step, you created linked services **AzureStorageLinkedService1** and **AzureSqlLinkedService1** to link an Azure Storage account and Azure SQL database to the data factory: **ADFTutorialDataFactory**.
trans-unit.target: In the previous step, you created linked services **AzureStorageLinkedService1** and **AzureSqlLinkedService1** to link an Azure Storage account and Azure SQL database to the data factory: **ADFTutorialDataFactory**.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will define two data factory tables -- **EmpTableFromBlob** and **EmpSQLTable** -- that represent the input/output data that is stored in the data stores referred by AzureStorageLinkedService1 and AzureSqlLinkedService1 respectively.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will define two data factory tables -- **EmpTableFromBlob** and **EmpSQLTable** -- that represent the input/output data that is stored in the data stores referred by AzureStorageLinkedService1 and AzureSqlLinkedService1 respectively.

trans-unit.source: For EmpTableFromBlob, you will specify the blob container that contains a blob with the source data and for EmpSQLTable, you will specify the SQL table that will store the output data.
trans-unit.target: For EmpTableFromBlob, you will specify the blob container that contains a blob with the source data and for EmpSQLTable, you will specify the SQL table that will store the output data.

trans-unit.source: Create the input table
trans-unit.target: Create the input table

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Tables** in the **Solution Explorer**, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Tables** in the **Solution Explorer**, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add New Item** dialog box, select **Azure Blob**, and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add New Item** dialog box, select **Azure Blob**, and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the JSON text with the following text and save the **AzureBlobLocation1.json** file.
trans-unit.target: Replace the JSON text with the following text and save the **AzureBlobLocation1.json** file.

trans-unit.source: Create the output table
trans-unit.target: Create the output table

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Tables** in the **Solution Explorer** again, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Tables** in the **Solution Explorer** again, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add New Item** dialog box, select **Azure SQL**, and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add New Item** dialog box, select **Azure SQL**, and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the JSON text with the following JSON and save the **AzureSqlTableLocation1.json** file.
trans-unit.target: Replace the JSON text with the following JSON and save the **AzureSqlTableLocation1.json** file.

trans-unit.source: Create the pipeline
trans-unit.target: Create the pipeline

trans-unit.source: You have created input/output linked services and tables so far.
trans-unit.target: You have created input/output linked services and tables so far.

trans-unit.source: Now, you will create a pipeline with a **Copy Activity** to copy data from the Azure blob to Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: Now, you will create a pipeline with a **Copy Activity** to copy data from the Azure blob to Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Pipelines** in the **Solution Explorer**, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Pipelines** in the **Solution Explorer**, point to **Add**, and click **New Item**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Copy Data Pipeline** in the **Add New Item** dialog box and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Copy Data Pipeline** in the **Add New Item** dialog box and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the JSON with the following JSON and save the **CopyActivity1.json** file..
trans-unit.target: Replace the JSON with the following JSON and save the **CopyActivity1.json** file..

trans-unit.source: Publish/deploy Data Factory entities
trans-unit.target: Publish/deploy Data Factory entities

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar area, right-click and select **Data Factory** to enabled the Data Factory toolbar if it is not already enabled.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar area, right-click and select **Data Factory** to enabled the Data Factory toolbar if it is not already enabled.

trans-unit.source: In the **Data Factory toolbar**, click the **drop-down box** to see all the data factories in your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: In the **Data Factory toolbar**, click the **drop-down box** to see all the data factories in your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you see the **Sign-in to Visual Studio** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: If you see the **Sign-in to Visual Studio** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Enter the **email account** associated with the Azure subscription in which you want to create the data factory, enter **Password**, and click **Sign-in**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **email account** associated with the Azure subscription in which you want to create the data factory, enter **Password**, and click **Sign-in**.

trans-unit.source: Once the sign-in is successful, you should see all the data factories in the Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Once the sign-in is successful, you should see all the data factories in the Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create a new data facotry.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create a new data facotry.

trans-unit.source: In the drop-down list, select **ADFTutorialFactoryVS**, and click **Publish** button to deploy/publish the linked services, datasets, and the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: In the drop-down list, select **ADFTutorialFactoryVS**, and click **Publish** button to deploy/publish the linked services, datasets, and the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Publish button
trans-unit.target: Publish button

trans-unit.source: You should see the status of publishing in the Data Factory Task List window that is shown in the picture above.
trans-unit.target: You should see the status of publishing in the Data Factory Task List window that is shown in the picture above.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that publishing has succeeded.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that publishing has succeeded.

trans-unit.source: Use Server Explorer to review Data Factory entities
trans-unit.target: Use Server Explorer to review Data Factory entities

trans-unit.source: In **Visual Studio**, click **View** on the menu, and click **Server Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: In **Visual Studio**, click **View** on the menu, and click **Server Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: In the Server Explorer window, expand **Azure** and expand **Data Factory**.
trans-unit.target: In the Server Explorer window, expand **Azure** and expand **Data Factory**.

trans-unit.source: If you see **Sign in to Visual Studio**, enter the **account** associated with your Azure subscription and click **Continue**.
trans-unit.target: If you see **Sign in to Visual Studio**, enter the **account** associated with your Azure subscription and click **Continue**.

trans-unit.source: Enter **password**, and click **Sign in**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **password**, and click **Sign in**.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio tries to get information about all Azure data factories in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio tries to get information about all Azure data factories in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: You will see the status of this operation in the **Data Factory Task List** window.
trans-unit.target: You will see the status of this operation in the **Data Factory Task List** window.

trans-unit.source: ![Server Explorer](./media/data-factory-get-started-using-vs/server-explorer.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Server Explorer](./media/data-factory-get-started-using-vs/server-explorer.png)

trans-unit.source: You can right-click on a data factory, and select Export Data Factory to New Project to create a Visual Studio project based on an existing data factory.
trans-unit.target: You can right-click on a data factory, and select Export Data Factory to New Project to create a Visual Studio project based on an existing data factory.

trans-unit.source: Export data factory to a VS project
trans-unit.target: Export data factory to a VS project

trans-unit.source: Update Data Factory tools for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Update Data Factory tools for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: To update Azure Data Factory tools for Visual Studio, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To update Azure Data Factory tools for Visual Studio, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Click **Tools** on the menu and select **Extensions and Updates**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Tools** on the menu and select **Extensions and Updates**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Updates** in the left pane and then select **Visual Studio Gallery**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Updates** in the left pane and then select **Visual Studio Gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Azure Data Factory tools for Visual Studio** and click **Update**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Azure Data Factory tools for Visual Studio** and click **Update**.

trans-unit.source: If you do not see this entry, you already have the latest version of the tools.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see this entry, you already have the latest version of the tools.

trans-unit.source: See [Monitor datasets and pipeline](data-factory-get-started-using-editor.md/#MonitorDataSetsAndPipeline) for instructions on how to use the Azure Preview Portal to monitor the pipeline and datasets you have created in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: See [Monitor datasets and pipeline](data-factory-get-started-using-editor.md/#MonitorDataSetsAndPipeline) for instructions on how to use the Azure Preview Portal to monitor the pipeline and datasets you have created in this tutorial.

trans-unit.target: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.
